definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: The sympathetic widower who doesn''t have time to date because he''s raising a kid.
sentences.chinese: 有同情心的鳏夫，因为要抚养孩子而没时间去约会。

sentences.english: Even elderly widows and widowers choose to live on their own.
sentences.chinese: 连年迈的寡妇和鳏夫都选择独自生活。

sentences.english: There are legions of lonely widows and widowers in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国有众多孤独的寡妇和鳏夫。

sentences.english: George was a widower with six young children.
sentences.chinese: 乔治是个带着六个小阿子的鳏夫。

sentences.english: I am 80-plus and have recently become a widower.
sentences.chinese: 我80多岁了，最近刚成为鳏夫。

sentences.english: The widower sat casting sheep's eyes at a half- caste girl all the evening.
sentences.chinese: 那个鳏夫整个晚上坐着向一个混血少女以目传情。

sentences.english: Maybe he’s widowed and dating a Thai woman?
sentences.chinese: 要么他是个鳏夫正在约会泰国女人？

definition: to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to stay at home while one's husband is away/grass widow
